summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to attorneys Jay and Roy Black, summarizing a hearing before Judge Marra regarding the disclosure of a confidential agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein. The judge ordered the agreement be made available to plaintiffs (victims) and their counsel under a protective order, and allowed plaintiffs to litigate further disclosure directly with Epstein in their civil suits.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Recipient of the email summarizing a court hearing outcome regarding the disclosure of a confidential agreement in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Recipient of the email, likely a colleague of Roy Black, involved in the legal proceedings concerning the confidential agreement.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: Presided over the hearing and issued orders regarding the disclosure of a confidential agreement to plaintiffs/victims and their attorneys under a protective order.

persons.name: Mr. Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the party with whom plaintiffs can litigate the issue of further disclosure of the confidential agreement in the context of their civil suits.

connections.description: Both are recipients of the legal update email regarding the court hearing, indicating they are working together on the case.
Roy Black is a defense attorney receiving updates on a court order affecting Epstein's confidential agreement, strongly suggesting he represents Epstein.
Judge Marra issued a court order governing the disclosure of a confidential agreement involving Epstein and the plaintiffs in the case.

events.title: Hearing before Judge Marra
events.description: A court hearing where Judge Marra ordered a confidential agreement be made available to plaintiffs (victims) and their counsel under a protective order, and allowed further disclosure issues to be litigated directly with Epstein in civil suits.

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney who sent the email.

keyFacts: A confidential agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein was the subject of a court hearing before Judge Marra.
Judge Marra ordered the agreement be disclosed to plaintiffs (victims) and their attorneys, but only under a protective order limiting its use.
The order also required the agreement be made available to any other identified victim and her attorney who agree to the protective order.
The plaintiffs were given the right to litigate the issue of further disclosure directly with Jeffrey Epstein in their civil suits.
The communication reveals ongoing civil litigation and protective order negotiations in the Epstein case as of August 2008.
